The Elder Uppalahatthika’s Birth Story
“I lived in the three-peaked mountain,
and at that time I was a garland-maker;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the perfected one, Siddhattha, worshipped by the world.
With a confident mind, full of joy,
I gave a hand of flowers;
Wherever I was reborn,
by the power of that deed.
I experienced a desirable fruit,
of my own good deeds in the past;
I was surrounded by good people,
this was the fruit of giving flowers.
For ninety-four aeons,
the flowers I offered;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
For ninety-four aeons,
except for the present one;
There were five hundred kings there,
called Najja and Samana.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Uppalahatthika recited these verses.
